name: John Davidson
comments: Singer, television personality and game show host.

name: Jewel
comments: Singer, songwriter, guitarist, producer, actress and poet

name: Stanley Turrentine
aliases: Stanley Turrentine with The Three Sounds
comments: Jazz tenor saxophonist who played bop, hard bop and soul-jazz. Turrentine also composed.

name: Wayne Marshall
comments: Organist, pianist and conductor born in Oldham, Lancashire.

name: John Miles
comments: Singer, producer, guitarist and keyboard player

name: Prince
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer, songwriter and, after a high profile dispute with his former label, record label owner.

name: Bart Peeters
comments: Singer, songwriter, drummer, guitarist, presenter and actor

name: Erasure
comments: Synth-pop duo who had several hits in the 1980s

name: The Three Degrees
comments: Female vocal trio from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

name: The Righteous Brothers
comments: Vocal duo, with Bill Medley, the taller of the two, providing the bass-baritone, and blond-haired Bobby Hatfield singing tenor. Their style would later be dubbed “blue-eyed soul”.

name: UB40
comments: Reggae/pop band formed in Birmingham. In January 2008, frontman Ali Campbell left the band, followed shortly thereafter by keyboardist Mickey Virtue and Astro in November 2013. The following year, legal advice was sought by the original band (along with new vocalist Duncan Campbell) against the group containing Campbell, Virtue and Astro over usage of the band name, due to it being used by both parties.

name: A Tribe Called Quest
comments: Hip hop group formed in Queens, New York

name: Joan Osborne
comments: Singer and songwriter best known for a soul-influenced pop. She has performed a wide variety of styles, including blues and country.

name: Het Nieuwe Wereldorkest
comments: Band that wrote a song on weekly basis for the Flemish Radio 1 program "De Nieuwe Wereld".

name: Will Tura
comments: Musician (guitar, piano), singer, songwriter, composer and performer. Received the title of knight in 2001.

name: Adamo
aliases: Adamo en duet avec Daniel Auteuil
comments: Singer-songwriter with Italian roots most popular in France and Canada

name: Dave Lee [GB1]
aliases: Joey Negro Presents The Sunburst Band
Joey Negro and The Sunburst Band
comments: DJ and house music producer, using many pseudonyms.

name: Lou Donaldson
comments: Jazz alto saxophonist who has recorded in the bop, mainstream, and soul jazz genres.

name: Marlena Shaw
comments: Soul, disco and jazz singer, active since the 1960s. Her music has often been sampled in hip hop music, and used in television commercials.

name: St. Germain
comments: Alias Saint Germain, pioneer of the French Touch, the new electronic music of France

name: Beastie Boys
comments: Hip hop band from New York, originally formed as a hardcore punk group

name: Kraftwerk
comments: Pioneering and highly influential electronic music act founded in Düsseldorf. Kraftwerk was the first German group to gain a no. 1 in the US Billboard charts with "Autobahn".

name: Roberta Flack
comments: Singer and pianist.  Flack has performed and recorded jazz, R&B, pop and soul music.

name: Joe Augustine
comments: Jazz pianist based in Ohio and collegiate music educator.

name: Mike Auldridge
comments: Dobro player.  Auldridge played bluegrass fused with jazz, folk and pop.  Auldridge was also a songwriter and singer.

name: Donald Brown
comments: Jazz pianist, composer and educator, currently at the University of Tennessee.

name: Rusty Bryant
aliases: Rusty Bryant and The Carolyn Club Band
Rusty Bryant and Carolyn Club Band
comments: Jazz tenor and alto saxophonist from Columbus, Ohio

name: Hampton Hawes
comments: Jazz pianist born in Los Angeles, California

name: Engelbert Humperdinck
comments: India-born singer. Due to a law suit won by German composer Engelbert Humperdinck's successors, Dorsey was forced to skip the family name for releases and appearances in Germany.

name: Sérgio Mendes
comments: Pianist, bandleader, composer.  Mendes played in many genres, including bossa nova, smooth jazz, Latin jazz, Latin pop, soft rock.

name: Rick Marotta
comments: Drummer and percussionist, who became one of the top studio drummers in New York and L.A. (Linda Rondstadt, Steely Dan, Carly Simon, James Taylor and Bonnie Raitt)

name: Lisa Marr
comments: A musician, songwriter, film-maker, photographer, and educator She has performed as a solo artist, guest and as a member of The Indecisives, The Bombshells, Soda & His Million Piece Band and The Here + Now She has been credited as the originator of a sub-genre of music known as cuddlecore

name: Rat Pack
comments: Hardcore/punk band from Santa Barbara, California

name: The Suburbs
comments: Alternative rock and roll/funk/new wave band from the Minneapolis suburbs.

name: Asia
comments: Formed as a progressive rock band, the members listed constitute the original line-up.  The group has had many personnel changes over the years, with the original members together only until 1983 before they reunited under the Asia name in 2006. The original Asia broke up in 1986, reuniting (but not all the original members) in 1989.  In 1991, vocalist/bassist John Payne joined Geoff Downes in recruiting new members for Asia and, Payne and Downes led Asia until 2005.  In 2006, Downes decided to rejoin the original members of Asia and to tour under this name.  A dispute over the use of the name "Asia" was resolved when an agreement was reached that allowed Payne to use the name "Asia Featuring John Payne".  In fact, this band included other members of later incarnations of Asia, in addition to Payne.

name: Clark Dennis
comments: Irish tenor from Flint, Michigan. He sang with Paul Whiteman in the late 1930s and recorded under his own name in the 1940s and early-1950s.

name: Hal Derwin
aliases: Hal Derwin and His Orchestra with Gloria and Diane
comments: Vocalist and guitarist; he dubbed a number of vocals for motion pictures in the 1940s and 1950s.

name: Edwin van Hoevelaak
comments: Songwriter, producer and record label owner.

name: Meme Bianchi
comments: Singer, active from the mid-1930s to the end of the 1950s.

name: The Cadets [IE]
comments: Showband from Dublin fronted by singer Reed

name: Red Simpson
comments: Country musician, playing piano and guitar, and singer, who recorded truck driving songs in the 1960s and 1970s. Simpson is however best known as a songwriter.

name: Vision Divine
comments: Power/progressive metal band, founded by Olaf Thorsen and Fabio Lione in 1999. From Massa, Tuscany

name: The Abyssinians
comments: Influential reggae vocal and dub trio often adding elements of Ethiopian folk to their music. In their lyrics and lifestyle, the band promoted the Rastafari religion.

name: Bradley Brown
comments: Reggae and R&B drummer and singer from Nassau. Currently residing in the US.

name: Kike Turmix
comments: Basque born, Madrid based punk rock musician, music journalist, and record label owner ( Roto Records and Safety Pin Records ).

name: The Safety Pins
comments: Spanish punk rock band from Bilbao

name: Nat Wright
comments: Jazz, soul and R&B vocalist. Also active in both Germany and Italy under the alias 'Tony Moore' in the 1970s.

name: Nilla Pizzi
comments: Singer and actress born in Sant'Agata Bolognese, who was particularly famous in Italy during the 1950s and 1960s and won the first edition of the San Remo Festival in 1951

name: Judy Roderick
comments: Folk and blues singer and songwriter

name: The Egomaniacs
comments: High-energy rock band from Upstate NY.

name: Silver Tongued Devil
comments: Punk rock band from Pittsburgh, PA. Formed in 1997.

name: Amanda Palmer
aliases: Amanda Palmer & The Grand Theft Orchestra

name: Milk at Midnight
comments: Indie rock trio from Chicago, Illinois

name: Small Halo
comments: Echo Park, California-based music project by former Switchblade Symphony members Tina Root and George Earth. Started in 2008. the project has so far recorded one self-titled five-song EP, which they released in 2009.

name: The Brooklyn Bridge
aliases: Johnny Maestro and The Brooklyn Bridge
comments: Musical group best known for their million-selling rendition of Jimmy Webb's "Worst That Could Happen" (1968).

name: John Nicholas
aliases: Johnny Nicholas and The Texas All-Stars

name: Leslie Mendelson
comments: Singer/songwriter based in Manhattan, New York

name: Anthony B. Stephens
comments: Musician, songwriter, VP of the Source Music Group

name: Arnecia Harris
comments: Songwriter now living in Houston, TX

name: The Hunchbacks
comments: French punk rock band from Saint-Etienne

name: The Easy Livin'
comments: Garage punk band from New York City, NY, USA

name: Sergio
comments: Singer, performer, songwriter and TV presentor

name: Exhumation
comments: Melodic death metal band formed in Thessaloniki.

name: Elsie Baker
comments: Singer and actress who was on stage as an infant until just before her death.

name: Extrema
comments: Thrash/groove metal band formed in Milano.

name: Susan Reed
comments: Folk singer, harpist, zitherist and actress.

name: Judy Cook
comments: Folksinger and storyteller born in Virginia

name: Tom Lehrer
comments: Primarily an academic and scientist, Lehrer in the 1950s was a researcher at the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory and even worked for the NSA. Later, until his retirement in 2001, he taught collegiate level mathematics, political science and musical theatre at various times. In the 1950s and 1960s, Lehrer wrote and performed satirical and humorous songs.  After the early 1960s, he rarely performed publicly.  In the early-1970s, he wrote some songs for the educational children's program, "The Electric Company".  Since then, he has basically retired from music.

name: Danny Hice
comments: Songwriter, producer, aircraft pilot, studio owner and voice actor.

name: Jack Robinson
comments: Former journalist and disc jockey, artistic director, record producer, disco songwriter and lyricist Founded Robin Song Music publishing company

name: Melissa Morgan
comments: New York born jazz vocalist and pianist.

name: Bert Shefter
aliases: Bert Shefter and His String Octet
comments: Russian born musician, arranger and film composer. Come to America on a scholarship to study at the arts division of Carnegie Institute of Technology, and later at the Curtis Institute and Damrosch Institute.

name: Anita Harris [GB]
comments: Dancer, singer, performer on variety shows and actress

name: Harald Paulsen
aliases: Harald Paulsen mit Robert Renard Tanz-Orchester
comments: Stage actor, film actor and director. He appeared in 125 films between 1920 and 1954. Paulsen played Macheath in the original cast of Die Dreigroschenoper written by composer Kurt Weill (1900–1950) and playwright Bertolt Brecht (1898–1956).

name: Marc Atkinson [CA]
comments: Guitarist. The Marc Atkinson Trio is a gypsy jazz band.

name: Ego Likeness
comments: Band described as goth, trip hop, and/or darkwave formed in 1999.

name: Louise Tobin
comments: Big band singer from Texas. She appeared with Benny Goodman, Bobby Hackett, Will Bradley, and Jack Jenney.

name: Michael Moore [US1]
comments: Jazz saxophonist and clarinetist who has lived in The Netherlands since 1982

name: A Witness
comments: Indie pop band from Stockport, England

name: CapaRezza
comments: Alternative rock and hip-hop singer and rapper

name: Eldritch
comments: Power-prog metal band from Florence. Active since 1991.

name: The Tielman Brothers
aliases: Andy Tielman und die Tielman Brothers
comments: Brothers born in Indonesia with Dutch-German ancestry. They pioneered rock 'n' roll and "Indo Rock" (rock 'n' roll with an Indonesian influence) in The Netherlands after moving there in 1957.

name: The Black League
comments: Heavy rock band from Oulu founded in 1998 by Taneli Jarva.

name: Clyde McCoy
aliases: Clyde McCoy and His Drake Hotel Orchestra
Clyde McCoy His Trumpet and Orchestra

name: Marsha Hunt
comments: Singer, actor, and novelist. Although married to Mike Ratledge since 1967, the pair separated almost immediately while maintaining cordial relations.  In November 1970, her only child and the first child of Mick Jagger was born.

name: Key of Dreams
comments: Studio band formed by Maurizio Vandelli to record a disco-friendly cover of "Africa".

name: Jean Wells
comments: Soul singer and songwriter based in Philadelphia, PA

name: Ruben and The Jets
comments: Band with mainly Latin American roots, but also influenced by the Doo Wop era and avantgarde composers. Deriving their name from Cruising With Ruben & The Jets , the group even toured with Frank Zappa in 1972.

name: Hank Sanicola
comments: Music manager, songwriter, publisher, businessman and pianist, best known for his work and association with Frank Sinatra from the late 1930s to the early 1960s.

name: Golinski Brothers
comments: Post-punk band, formed on the campus of Sussex University, Brighton

name: Trea Dobbs
comments: Singer and lyricist, born in Eindhoven

name: Marilyn Lee
comments: Studio vocalist specialized in sound-alike covers for the British Embassy label

name: The Vietnam Veterans
comments: Garage / psychedelic rock band from Burgundy

name: Seasick Steve
comments: Blues singer, songwriter, and guitarist. He often plays unusual custom-made stringed instruments.

name: The Baseballs
comments: Rockabilly vocal trio formed in Berlin and comprising of Sven Budja, Rüdiger Brans & Sebastian Rätzel

name: i:Scintilla
comments: Chicago-based electro/industrial band. Brittany Bindrim, Chad Mines, Jason Allen, Jim Cookas.

name: Fanny Brice
comments: Comedienne and singer-actress with numerous appearances in movies, on the stage and on radio

name: Mickey Katz
aliases: Mickey Katz and Der Ganser Gang
comments: Musician and comedian known for his song parodies in Yiddish and English.

name: Richard Hayes
comments: Pop vocalist and stage actor. Hayes was also the host of several game shows in the 1950s and 1960s, and a guest star on various variety shows.

name: Eddie Sauter
comments: Trumpeter, composer, arranger and co-leader of the Sauter-Finegan Orchestra

name: The UNLV Jazz Ensemble
comments: University of Nevada at Las Vegas (UNLV) student band

name: Werner Müller
aliases: Werner Müller mit kleiner Tanzbesetzung und Gesangs-Quintett
comments: Producer, arranger, and composer of space age pop music.    Müller became the director of of one of Germany's most popular radio orchestras in 1948, moving to the same position for an even more popular radio orchestra in 1967.

name: Carmen Cavallaro
aliases: Carmen Cavallaro and Columbia Pictures' "The Eddy Duchin Story" Orchestra
Carmen Cavallaro His Orchestra and Chorus
Carmen Cavallaro and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Don Burke

name: George Siravo
comments: Composer, arranger, conductor, saxophonist, and clarinetist. As arranger Sivaro worked with Frank Sinatra, Doris Day, Tony Bennett and other singers.

name: Everything Is Everything
aliases: Everything Is Everything featuring Chris Hills

name: Jim Pepper
comments: Jazz saxophonist of Native American ancestry.

name: Manilla Road
comments: Heavy metal band from Wichita, Kansas

name: Oregon
comments: Improvising group playing jazz and world music formed in 1970.

name: Topo D. Bill
comments: Offshoot of The Bonzo Dog Band .

name: Walter Norris
comments: Jazz pianist, composer and teacher. Norris lived in Berlin from 1977 until passing away.

name: Jamaaladeen Tacuma
comments: Electric bass player, experimental Nu Jazz performer and composer

name: Howlett Smith
comments: Pianist, singer, composer, producer and teacher

name: Medicine
comments: Noise pop band, described as "the American answer to My Bloody Valentine "

name: Luiz Gonzaga
comments: Prominent singer, songwriter, musician and poet

name: Humberto Teixeira
comments: Lawyer, politician, musician and composer best known for his partnership with musician Luiz Gonzaga. Together, they wrote "Asa Branca", one of the most important songs of their era.

name: audiotransparent
comments: Indie-pop band with influences of post-rock, slowcore and country

name: Altamiro Carrilho
aliases: Altamiro Carrilho e seu conjunto de solistas
Altamiro Carrilho e seu conjunto regional
Altamiro Carrilho e sua orquestra de flautas

name: Renee Sands
comments: Singer and former child actress, best known for her role as Renee on Kids Incorporated.

name: Dick Rosmini
comments: Rosmini was an important figure in the 1960s folk revival, playing six and twelve string guitars. He is deemed to have been the best 12-string guitarist of his time by many. Rosmini mostly recorded as a sideman. After leaving music as a career, he pursued work as a photographer and taught recording for in excess of ten years at the University of Southern California. Rosmini is one of the individuals who played a role in the way motion picture sound has evolved.

name: Moonsorrow
comments: Folk-black metal band from Helsinki, who draw inspiration from Finland's pagan history and spirituality.

name: Susan Boyle
comments: Scottish singer who rose to fame after appearing on Britain's Got Talent in 2009

name: At the Gates
comments: Death metal band from Gotherburg, considered to be one of the progenitors of the so-called "Gothenburg style" of melodic death metal.

name: Enslaved
comments: Progressive extreme metal band, originaly established in Sveio, but currently based in Bergen. Established by Grutle Kjellson (then 17 years) and Ivar Bjørnson (then 13 years) in 1991

name: Edward Woodward
comments: Screen and stage actor, most well-known for his roles on film in "The Wicker Man" and "Breaker Morant", and on TV in "Callan" and "The Equalizer".

name: Polycorn
comments: In 2004 Polycorn was part of Reboot, a live Drum n Bass band. After a combination-for-the-occasion performance at the end of 2005 together with Niels Vermeulen and Jurgen van Harskamp, Polycorn joined Sobchek, a live-electronics / glitch / breakbeat / whatever-we-think-sounds-nice group. Polycorn does solo work, though the majority is in combination with other artists.

name: Rude 66
comments: Producer, electronic musician and recording artist

name: Nanko
comments: Guitarist and electronic musician from Rotterdam

name: Piney Gir
comments: Born in Kansas but based in London since 1998

name: The Five Boroughs
comments: Harmony vocal group from South Florida.

name: The Band of Blacky Ranchette
comments: Blacky Ranchette is the alter ego of Howe Gelb, leader of Giant Sand. He formed the Band of Blacky Ranchette in the mid-'80s as a way to explore straight country music. They released four albums: The eponymous debut album was released in 1985, followed by "Heartland" in 1986. Four years later, the group released its third effort "Sage Advice" in 1990. After a longer hiatus, the fourth and final album "Still Lookin' Good to Me" followed in 2003.

name: Dumptruck
comments: Alternative/college rock band.  The band's success was hampered by legal difficulties, although Seth Tiven, the sole continuous member of the band continues to use the band name from time to time.

name: etypejazz
comments: Jazz/pop band from Adelaide: Lisa Michelle - vocals ; Beth Lyon - alto saxophone, flute ; Ritsuko Dalton - piano ; Dan Gordon - double bass ; Frank Fagomeni - drums.

name: Natives of the New Dawn
comments: Rock/hip hop/soul fusion band based in the Detroit area.

name: Orange Nichole
comments: Indie band based in Salem, Massachusetts

name: Ula
comments: Folk/western music duo based in San Francisco.

name: Jud Conlon
comments: Longtime musical arranger for Walt Disney.

name: Misery Inc.
comments: Melodic groove metal band from Myrskylä

name: Ayria
comments: Electro / industrial project of Jennifer Parkin

name: 32crash
comments: Electro band project formed by Jan D'Hooghe, Jean-Luc De Meyer and Len Lemeire

name: Kathleen Aerts
comments: Singer, actress and host, who was a member of the successful Flemish girl group K3.

name: Karel Gott
comments: Probably the most famous Czech pop singer ever. Known as the "Golden Voice of Prague". Born in Pilsen.

name: Ralph Siegel
comments: Pop music songwriter, producer, and record label owner

name: Marianne Rosenberg
comments: Discovered at a talent contest at the age of 14, she recorded her first single, "Mr. Paul McCartney", soon after and soon became one of the best known German Schlager singers. She is a daughter of the former board member of the Central Council of German Sinti and Roma, Otto Rosenberg.

name: Nicole [DE]
comments: Maiden name Nicole Hohloch. Singer who won the Eurovision Song Contest in 1982 as the first German winner with the song "Ein bißchen Frieden" (A Little Peace), which was a huge #1 hit in Europe and even reached the top of the UK Singles Chart.

name: Willy Alberti
comments: Leading exponent of the "smartlap" (tearjerker) genre from the 1940s to the late 1970s, with a keen interest in Italian canzone songs.

name: Gerry Monroe
comments: Pop singer, active in the first half of the 1970s.

name: Werner Schüler
comments: Munich-based bassist, lyricist, producer and recording studio owner

name: Christian Bruhn
comments: Composer, music producer,German royalty collecting society GEMA's chairman of the board (1991-2009), and temporary president of CISAC (umbrella organisation of copyright societies). Including many well-known jingles etc., there are 2000+ works (co-)registered in Bruhn's name.

name: Tony Marshall
aliases: Tony Marshall und seine Lustigen Musikanten

name: Jean Frankfurter
comments: Composer and producer born in Frankfurt

name: Erik Silvester
comments: Schlager music singer, songwriter and producer

name: Harm Breemer
comments: Singer, songwriter and translator, who is best known for his two Dutch #1 hits in the 1970s using the alias Alexander Curly "I'll Never Drink Again", and "Guus (Guus, kom naar huus, want de koeien staan op springen)". In the beginning of the 1980s he withdrew from the music scene.

name: Tom Manders Jr.
comments: Film director, producer, writer of scenarios. Alias: Ricardo Mandera

name: Rex Gildo
aliases: Rex Gildo mit Chor und Orchester

name: Daniele Antonelli
comments: Born in Italy, lived in the USA from the age of 5 until 1980 and has lived in Hamburg since 1982

name: Audrey Landers
comments: Singer and actress best known for her role as Afton Cooper in the television series "Dallas" and her role as Val Clarke in the film version of "A Chorus Line" (1985)

name: Steve Hewitt [GB]
comments: Rock multi-instrumentalist, singer and record producer

name: Before the Dawn
comments: Melodic death metal band from Nastola.

name: The Zantees
comments: Rockabilly band from New York City

name: Billy Miller
comments: Singer, rock 'n' roll collector and archivist whose magazine, Kicks and record label, Norton (both co-founded with his wife Miriam Linna), championed vintage rockabilly and garage bands.

name: Royal Trux
comments: Alternative rock band, active from 1987 till 2001.

name: Rainer Pietsch
comments: Musician, songwriter and arranger born in Walburg

name: Tiziano Ferro
comments: Singer, Grammy Award winning, songwriter, producer and author, who broke through in 2001 with his international hit single "Perdono" and has remained successful since then in several countries. He has released a Spanish version of each of his albums and has also sung in English, Portuguese, and French.

name: Straight No Chaser
comments: Professional a cappella group formed by the original members of the college male a cappella group of the same name put together in 1996 by Dan Ponce while group members were students together at Indiana University. In 2006, the original founding members were invited to "reunite" with the current members for a one-off concert. A clip of the performance of "The 12 Days of Christmas" was uploaded to YouTube and went viral, receiving millions of hits. This popularity attracted Atlantic to approach Ponce and other alumni of the group in "reforming" for a record contract deal, which gave birth to the professional a cappella group Straight No Chaser. For the first few years, the university a cappella group performed and released albums concurrently, until 2012 when it was decided that the college ensemble would change its name to Another Round.

name: Shit & Chanel
comments: Girl band in pop rock and folk rock

name: KrunK
comments: Alt rock band based in Los Angeles. Renamed "Kottak" in 2006.

name: Fluchtweg
comments: Punk band formed in Neuruppin, East Germany, but now based in Berlin

name: Action Painters
comments: Power pop / new wave band from Brooklyn, NY. Formed in 2006.

name: Matador
comments: Experimental Synth-Pop trio, consisting of three females influential on the those days experimenting (West) Berlin music scene. Releases these days handled by former band member Gudrun Gut 's label Monika .

name: Albert Stanton
comments: Music publisher, promoter, and producer. Active as a songwriter under the pseudonym Albert Stanton.

name: Grover Dale
comments: Actor, dancer, choreographer and theatre director. His Broadway stage debut was in the 1956 musical "Li'l Abner" as a dancer. He appeared in the original cast of West Side Story as Snowboy, a member of the Jets gang. Other stage credits include Noël Coward's Sail Away where he had the juvenile lead role of architect Barnaby Slade. Dale was nominated for the Tony Award twice: for his choreography of "Billy", a musical version of Herman Melville's "Billy Budd" and his direction of "The Magic Show".

name: Russ Tamblyn
comments: Actor with many appearances in movies and television, probably best known for his role as "Riff" in the movie version of "West Side Story"

name: Tony Mordente
comments: American dancer, choreographer, actor and television director from New York City, NY.

name: David Winters
comments: Dancer, choreographer, producer, director, screenwriter, and actor. Winters was born in London, England. His family relocated to the United States in 1953, and he became a U.S. citizen in 1956.

name: Schlong
comments: Punk band from the San Francisco Bay area

name: Jimmy Bryant [US2]
comments: Born in Birmingham, Alabama. Singer, arranger and composer. He is most well known for being a "ghost singer" for actor Richard Beymer in his role as Tony in the 1961 musical West Side Story . While he received no screen credit, he states that Beymer was "a nice guy, and every time he did an interview he would mention my name." He also sang for James Fox in the 1967 film musical Thoroughly Modern Millie, and sang in "The Telephone Hour" number in Bye Bye Birdie. He also sang in the group that performed the theme song of the TV series Batman.

name: Rita Moreno
comments: Puerto Rico-born actress, singer and dancer. Winner of the Academy Award, Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony Award.

name: George Chakiris
comments: Actor-singer-dancer, best known for his role as Bernardo in the film version of "West Side Story".

name: Yvonne Wilder
comments: American actress best known for her role as Alicia in West Side Story (1961).

name: Loïs Lane [NL]
comments: Pop band fronted by sisters Monique and Suzanne Klemann.

name: Matt Bronleewe
comments: Record producer, musician, novelist and songwriter

name: The Charts
comments: Doo wop group from Harlem, New York

name: Les Cooper
aliases: Les Cooper and The Soul Rockers
comments: Doo-wop and soul singer, pianist and songwriter

name: Clarence Johnson [US Trombonist]
comments: Trombonist turned record label owner and songwriter

name: Ted Koehler
comments: Lyricist for many standards.  Koehler's career in music began as a piano accompanist for silent films. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1972

name: Betty Blake
comments: Jazz  vocalist from Cincinnati who sang with Buddy Morrow's orchestra between 1955 and 1957.  She released one solo LP, and then dropped out of sight.  Year of birth may be 1938.

name: Zook
comments: Acoustic funk band. Formed in London in 2000, consisting of drummer/percussionist Simon Charterton and guitarist/harmonica player William Denton.

name: Coco Electrik
comments: Electro band: Anne Booty with Paul "Royal Appointment" Harrison & Matty "Skylab" Ducasse.

name: Gina G
comments: Pop singer who represented the UK at the Eurovision.

name: Sebastian Cabot
comments: Actor best known for his role as Mr. French on the American television series "Family Affair".

name: Milt Page
aliases: Milt Page Trio featuring Oscar Pettiford

name: Simon Shrimpton-Smith
comments: Belgium-based singer, guitarist and voice-over commentator

name: Octopus [BE]
comments: Belgian-British close harmony group, active in 1970s and successful in Belgium and The Netherlands

name: Dorinda Duncan
comments: Member of the 1960s folk group, the Briarwood Singers, who opened for the Beatles concert at Carnegie Hall on february 12, 1964.

name: Pete Steele
comments: Kentucky banjo player who was a coal miner for at least twenty years in Harlan County, Kentucky.

name: Topaz
comments: Band formed by René Le Roche, Michael Roeder & Adrian Le Monde

name: Cargo Cult
comments: Short-lived Austin, Texas, rock band. Active: 1985-1987.

name: Funky Aztecs
comments: Rap group based in Vallejo, California.

name: Urthboy
comments: hip hop MC and producer from New South Wales.

name: Charlie Calello
comments: Singer, conductor, and most prominently known as a prolific arranger and producer from the 1960s through the 1980s

name: Francy Boland
comments: Classically trained jazz pianist and composer.

name: Andrew VanWyngarden
comments: Indie rock/neo-psychedelic guitarist, singer and songwriter.

name: Greg Kurstin
comments: Songwriter and multi-instrumentalist. Engineer at Kingsize Soundlabs and Echo Studio (Los Angeles, California)

name: Marlon Brando
comments: Actor named Greatest Male Star of All Time by the American Film Institute. Probably his only singing role came in the movie "Guys and Dolls" (1955).

name: Kirby Stone
comments: Vocalist, group leader and later TV show director

name: Eddie Erickson
aliases: Eddie Erickson with The International Swing Band
comments: Vocalist, guitarist and banjoist. focusing on traditional jazz and swing material.  Erickson is based in the San Francisco Bay area.

name: The D's 3
comments: Mother-daughters vocal trio consisting of Kathy, Becky, and Corrie Duncan, specializing in swing music

name: Aurélien Wiik
comments: Actor. He was born in Calvados department (Normandy region) to a Norwegian father and a French mother.

name: Galáctico
comments: Keyboard player, composer , producer and artist

name: Page Cavanaugh
comments: Jazz and pop pianist born in Cherokee, Kansas

name: Vivian Blaine
aliases: Vivian Blaine and The Goldwyn Girls
Vivian Blaine and The Hot Box Girls

name: Gloria Lasso
comments: Singer, long based in France and later in Mexico

name: Marc Dex
comments: Singer and songwriter, born in Retie

name: Sphere
comments: Jazz quartet formed in tribute to Thelonious Monk.

name: The Gift [GB]
comments: Tribute band formed by Rick Buckler, former member of The Jam

name: The Magnificent Men
comments: Blue-eyed soul band with members originating from two Pennsylvania bands.

name: The Leaders
comments: Vocal group from Newport News, Virginia.

name: John William
comments: Ivory Coast-born singer, active from the middle of the 1950s till the first half of the 1970s

name: Goose Creek Symphony
comments: Country-rock from Arizona. Founding member Charles Gearheart was born and raised in Goose Creek, Kentucky.

name: The Les Humphries Singers
aliases: The Les Humphries Singers and Orchestra
The Les Humphries Singers and R.& R. Band
comments: Ethnically diverse pop group formed by Englishman Les Humphries in Hamburg

name: Cristina D'Avena
comments: Singer and actress, who made a name for herself in the 1980s as the singer of dozens of theme songs for Italian dubs of Japanese animated TV series. She also starred in "Love Me Licia", the Italian live action remake of the Japanese manga and anime "Ai shite Naito".

name: Alltheniko
comments: Heavy/thrash/power metal band from Vercelli, Piemonte

name: Hermes Nye
comments: Practicing attorney and folksinger who lived in Dallas, Texas.

name: Hargus Robbins
comments: Country music pianist / keyboardist, notable for his session work in Nashville

name: Ted Heath
aliases: Master Ted Heath and his Musick

name: Dymaxion
comments: New York-based post-rock project specialized in fusing playful sound collages with live instrumentation

name: Bob Asklöf
comments: Singer and actor, who lived and worked in France from 1962 until 1977, the year he returned to Sweden.

name: Werner Dafeldecker
comments: Jazz and avant-garde double bassist and composer.

name: Walter Malli
comments: Free jazz proponent plays drums and saxophone (principally soprano sax) among other instruments.  Malli is also an artist.

name: The Black Eyed Snakes
comments: Blues rock band from Duluth, Minnesota.

name: The Mulcays
aliases: The Mulcays and Their Electric Harmonicas
comments: Husband and wife duo consisting of Jimmy and Mildred Mulcay

name: Julian Gould
comments: Organist and pianist best known for space age pop music

name: Kirk Knuffke
comments: Jazz trumpeter and cornetist born in Colorado.

name: Natasha St-Pier
comments: Singer born in Bathurst, New Brunswick

name: Kiuas
comments: Kiuas (pronounced ‘Key-wass’), is a hybrid metal band using clean vocals on death metal musis. It was formed in the year 2000.

name: Roy Haynes
aliases: Roy Haynes and the Fountain of Youth Band

name: Alfredo [ES]
comments: Basque singer born in Bilbao. Later in his career he became a record producer for Philips and produced many Spanish bands from the 1970s onwards.

name: Alfi Kabiljo
comments: Croatian composer, conductor, arranger and producer born in Zagreb

name: Lonnie Irving
comments: Country music singer, guitar player and songwriter from North Carolina.

name: Walter Heynen
comments: Musician (flute), composer and arranger, born in Schoten, best known for his work with Wannes Van De Velde

name: Billy Meshel
comments: Songwriter and music publishing executive with a more than 50-year industry track record.

name: Harold Spiro
comments: English songwriter. He is best known for his co-writing with Valerie Avon, particularly the song "Long Live Love" (1974) performed by Olivia Newton-John, which was the UK's entry in the Eurovision Song Contest 1974.  He won an Ivor Novello Award for Best Novel or Unusual Song for co-writing "Nice One Cyril".

name: Phil Wainman
comments: Originally a drummer, who made his name as a songwriter and producer

name: Karl Precoda
comments: Guitarist and screenwriter, currently teaching cinema and cultural studies at Virginia Tech

name: Lee Perry
comments: Probably the most acknowledged and longest active Reggae/Dub producer/artist. In his long career having released an estimated 150 albums, Perry is known for his innovative production techniques as well as for his charismatic and eccentric character. He won a Grammy for his album "Jamaican E.T." in 2003. Perry is married to a Swiss and has been living in Switzerland since the late 1980s.

name: Kool Keith
comments: Rapper and producer from the Bronx, New York. Worked both as a solo artist and as part of many groups.

name: Ced Gee
comments: Rapper and hip hop producer from the Bronx, New York

name: Walter Vinson
comments: Memphis blues guitarist, singer and songwriter, sometimes using his mother's surname Jacobs.

name: Gene Levine
comments: Nashville-based songwriter (and occasional singer), specializing in country music.

name: Billy Sherrill
comments: Legendary record producer and composer in country music. Released some singles as a singer. In 1984, he was inducted into the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame.

name: Henry Strzelecki
comments: Bassist and songwriter from Birmingham, Alabama.

name: Gilles Thibaut
aliases: Gilles Thibaut, sa trompette et son orchestre
comments: Jazz trumpeter, singer, band leader and lyricist

name: Tom Evans [GB1]
comments: Bassist, singer and songwriter, from Liverpool

name: Tom Verlaine
aliases: Tom Verlaine and The Million Dollar Bashers
comments: Singer, songwriter and guitarist, best known as the frontman of the New York City rock band Television

name: Nick Gravenites
comments: Blues and rock singer, guitarist and songwriter

name: Timothy B. Schmit
comments: Bass guitarist and vocalist.  Schmit occasionally plays guitar and writes songs.  Schmit replaced Randy Meisner in both Poco and The Eagles.

name: Lou Deprijck
comments: Singer, songwriter and producer. A major figure in the Belgian pop scene of the 1970s and 1980s, with more than 20 million copies of his compositions sold worldwide. Best known for the Plastic Bertrand song 'Ça plane pour moi'.

name: Bob Hilliard
comments: Lyricist, who was inducted into The Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1983

name: Bob Nolan [US1]
comments: Born in Canada, Nolan went to live with his father in Arizona at age 13.  His father had changed his own last name to "Nolan", and Bob also adopted it.  A country singer-songwriter, he also appeared in approximately 100 Western movies.

name: Bob McDill
comments: Country music songwriter and guitarist born in Beaumont, Texas

name: Allen Reynolds
comments: Record producer and songwriter, primarily active in the country music field

name: Enotris Johnson
comments: Johnson and his wife, Ann, were white Seventh Day Adventists, who adopted some dozen children, black and white, including Little Richard.  Enotris was apparently given songwriting credits by Little Richard, who was apparently grateful to the Johnsons for providing him a home.

name: Georges Aber
comments: After a brief career as a singer (from 1959 till 1963), Aber became a lyricist.

name: Long Chris
comments: Singer of French rock and folk music in the 1960s and lyricist

name: Bob Montgomery
comments: Popular song writer, music publisher and producer

name: Kenny Edwards
comments: Singer/songwriter, producer, bassist, guitarist, mandolinist and session musician

name: Pierre Billon
comments: Artistic director, lyricist, composer and singer

name: Langston Hughes
comments: American poet, social activist, novelist, playwright, and columnist from Joplin, Missouri. He was one of the earliest innovators of the then-new literary art form called "jazz poetry". Hughes is best known as a leader of the Harlem Renaissance in New York City.

name: Jon Sundell
comments: Folksinger and musician, including banjo, guitar and autoharp.  Sundell lives in North Carolina.

name: Robert B. Sherman
comments: Songwriter and screenwriter in collaboration with his brother Richard. They had a 13-year career as staff songwriters for the Disney organization.

name: Richard Sherman
comments: Songwriter and screenwriter in collaboration with his brother Robert. They had a long relationship with the Disney organization, including a 13-year career as staff songwriters.

name: Lennaert Nijgh
comments: While Lennaert was best known as lyricist for Boudewijn de Groot as well as for other artists, he wrote also columns, books and musicals.

name: Alain Goraguer
comments: Jazz pianist and composer especially known for film scores

name: Robert Chauvigny
comments: Composer, orchestra leader and conductor; a personal friend and a frequent Edith Piaf collaborator

name: Charles Aznavour
comments: Legendary singer, composer with Armenian roots, who wrote and performed more than 1200 songs in 8 languages, and has also been acclaimed for his acting in more than 60 motion pictures. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1996.

name: Kurt Cobain
comments: Lead singer, guitarist, drummer and songwriter

name: Stan Lewis
comments: Record label owner, songwriter, producer from Shreveport, Louisiana

name: Cosmic Baby
comments: Classically trained pianist and electronics musician. After many years as a 'techno star', Blüchel turned to composing new classical works and theatre plays

name: Captain Beefheart
comments: Singer (with a multi-octave range), multi-instrumentalist, songwriter and performer until he retired from music in 1982, at which time he he gave up the "Beefheart" moniker and pursued a successful career as a visual artist, using the name "Don Van Vliet". His paintings have been exhibited in many major museums. Beefheart was also a published poet. Beefheart and Frank Zappa knew each other from their teen years when they developed a friendship over a shared interest in Chicago blues. Over the years, the pair had a love-hate relationship, but collaborated on several occasions. Beefheart was known to be harsh - even cruel - and exploitive of the musicians whom he hired for his band. Band members resented the fact that Beefheart took sole credit for the compositions that were really more collaborations. In his 2010 book, "Beefheart: Through the Eyes of Magic", John French recalled in detail his mistreatment by Beefheart, but he nonetheless worked for him on-again, off-again between 1966 and 1980 and remained in contact with Beefheart until the latter's death. Many musical artists have cited Beefheart as an important influence.

name: Lester Flatt
aliases: Lester Flatt and The Nashville Grass

name: Earl Scruggs
comments: Country and bluegrass banjo and guitar player.  Scruggs popularized three-finger style of banjo playing that became associated with bluegrass music. Some of his compositions were credited to his wife Louise Certain for tax reasons.

name: Reggie Lucas
comments: Musician, songwriter, record producer. Lucas was the guitarist in Miles Davis' group for five years from 1972 and then went on to write songs for Roberta Flack and Donny Hathaway and produce Madonna's first album.

name: The Moving Sidewalks
comments: Psychedelic blues rock band from Houston, Texas. Named after the pedestrian conveyance at Denver's Stapleton Airport, the band consisted of Billy Gibbons on guitar, Don Summers on bass, Dan Mitchell on drums, and Tom Moore on keyboards. After Moore and Summers were drafted into the army, Gibbons and Mitchell added Lanier Greig and formed the original ZZ Top .

name: Big Nick Nicholas
comments: Tenor saxophonist and occasional vocalist born in Lansing, Michigan, who played and recorded with such giants as Dizzy Gillespie and Miles Davis . John Coltrane was influenced by Nicholas and composed the song Big Nick as a tribute to him.

name: Alicia Grugett
comments: Alicia Grugett, coloratura soprano, was born in Havana, Cuba. Her family came to the United States when she was very young. She began voice lessons at the age of 15, and at 16 years of age, she sang the part of "Amahl" in Amahl and the Night Visitors with the Creative Opera of Miami, She continued to sing in various musicals during her high school years and graduated from the University of Miami with a Bachelor of Music degree in Voice and received her Master of Music degree in Voice Performance from the University of Michigan, both on scholarship. Ms. Grugett has sung with the Miami Opera, the Pittsburgh Opera apprentice program, the New Jersey State Opera, the Capital City Opera (Atlanta), the Allentown Symphony, the Atlanta Symphony and has won numerous vocal competitions.

name: Miki Jevremović
comments: Serbian singer, who was very popular in Yugoslavia in the 1970s.

name: Gene Lees
comments: Lyricist, singer and author of, among others, fiction, musical criticism, and biographies of musical artists.  He lived most of his adult life in the United States.

name: Gregg Field
comments: Jazz drummer, percussionist and producer born in Castro Valley, California

name: Muggsy Spanier
aliases: Muggsy Spanier and His Dixieland Band
Muggsy Spanier and His Ragtime Band

name: Rafael Ferro
comments: Composer, arranger, musical director and bandleader.

name: Svetislav Vuković
comments: Radio and TV host, pop-folk lyricist and journalist.

name: Dragan Stojnić
comments: One of the most popular Serbian singers in former Yugoslavia.

name: Cirque du Soleil
aliases: Tous les accrobates, techniciens et concepteurs du spectacle

name: Amici Forever
comments: Vocal quintet, consisting of classically trained opera singers who blend contemporary pop with traditional opera.

name: La Mafia
comments: Multi-awarded (a. o. 4x Grammy) Texicana band from Houston, Texas.

name: Rhydian Roberts
comments: A classically trained baritone, who achieved popularity through competing in the television talent show series "The X Factor" in 2007, finishing as runner-up, subsequently becoming a crossover artist, musical theatre actor and television presenter.

name: Alejandro Lerner
comments: Musician and singer-songwriter. He has written and sung countless songs including several hits, and his fame and recognition has spread all over South America.

name: Álvaro Carrillo
comments: Singer and composer, with more then 300 compositions on his account, and agronomy scientist

name: César Franck
comments: Composer, pianist, organist and music teacher born in Liège, who worked in Paris during his adult life

name: Thomas Aquinas
comments: Dominican friar, philosopher, Catholic priest, and Doctor of the Church, who is considered one of the Catholic Church's greatest theologians and philosophers

name: Fausto Papetti
aliases: Fausto Papetti et son saxophone alto

name: Helena Vondráčková
comments: One of the most popular Czech singers, who appeared in a few movies too. Born in Prague.

name: Herbie Crichlow
comments: Songwriter living and working in Sweden

name: Giorgia Fumanti
comments: Montreal, Canada-based operatic pop and crossover singer, songwriter, arranger and producer

name: Mike Appel
comments: Manager for Bruce Springsteen between 1972 and 1976, as well as the producer of his first two albums.

name: Katherine Jenkins
comments: Welsh opera singer born in Neath, Wales

name: William Joseph
comments: Pianist-composer-performer who describes his music as classical pop

name: William Henry Monk
comments: English organist, church musician and music editor who composed popular hymn tunes.

name: Escala
comments: Electronic string quartet from Britain's Got Talent

name: Nini Rosso
aliases: Nini Rosso e il suo complesso

name: Gordon Giltrap
comments: Best known as an acoustic folk guitarist, Giltrap sometimes plays electric guitar, and in other than folkstyle, including classical, blues, pop, and progressive rock.  He is also a composer and a was a regular columnist for "Acoustic" magazine.

name: Paul Miles-Kingston
comments: Classical singer who achieved fame as a boy treble; later director of music at a boarding school in York

name: Gabriel Fauré
comments: Romantic composer, organist, pianist and teacher. He was one of the foremost French composers of his generation and his musical style influenced many 20th-century composers.

name: Rolf Løvland
comments: Composer, lyricist, arranger, and pianist, who won the Eurovision Song Contest twice, composing the songs "La det swinge" in 1985 and composing and performing "Nocturne" in 1995 (with Secret Garden) resulting in Norway's first two titles.

name: Alexander Rybak
comments: Belarus-born violinist, singer, composer and actor

name: Pietro Mascagni
comments: Composer born in Livorno, who wrote a total of fifteen operas, plus an operetta, several orchestral and vocal works as well as songs and piano music. His most famous work is the opera "Cavalleria rusticana" (1890) and enjoyed immense success during his lifetime.

name: Jean Sibelius
comments: Composer and violinist of the late Romantic and early-modern periods. He is widely recognized as his country's greatest composer and - through his music - is often credited with having helped Finland to develop a national identity during its struggle for independence from Russia.

name: Veikko Antero Koskenniemi
comments: Poet born in Oulu and one of Finland's most popular writers. He was well known for his poems, travel books, and essays. He was influenced by Goethe, Runeberg, the French Parnassans and Symbolists. He is perhaps best known for writing the lyrics to the "Finlandia Hymn".

name: Kane Alexander
comments: Jazz and classical singer, and occasional TV and theatre actor

name: Kurt Darren
comments: Vocalist often performing in Afrikaans (South African Dutch)

name: Nick Perito
comments: Arranger and conductor, probably best know for his work with Perry Como.

name: Marc Ribot
aliases: Marc Ribot y los Cubanos Postizos

name: The Rogues [US1]
comments: Garage band from Rochester, New York.

name: Neal Wright
comments: West End actor and later agent

name: Lisa Stokke
comments: Singer and actress appearing primarily, but not exclusively, in musical productions.  Stokke has also appeared in Norwegian commercials/

name: Paul Clarkson
comments: Actor, singer, theatre director and teacher

name: Peter Schön
comments: Singer, multi-instrumentalist, arranger, producer, and songwriter.

name: André Breedland
comments: Actor, writer, known for his musicals '3 Musketiers', 'Ciske de Rat', 'Petticoat'...

name: Andrew Langtree
comments: Stage and screen actor and singer

name: Pavel Žák
comments: Composer and lyricist born in Rychnov nad Kněžnou

name: Julie Wilson [US]
comments: Singer-actress with many appearances in stage musicals and on television

name: Al Grey
aliases: Al Grey and The Basie Wing

name: Paul Vornhagen
comments: Saxophonist, flautist - playing straight ahead and Latin jazz - vocalist (vocalese) and songwriter based in Ann Arbor, Michigan.

name: Modern Sound Quintet
comments: Jazz band formed by steel pan player Rudy Smith.

name: Marie Rottrová
comments: Vocalist, songwriter and television presenter born in Ostrava.

name: Tanja Tzarovska
comments: Singer-songwriter born in Bitola. Currently living in London, UK.

name: Jonathan Ansell
comments: English singer, best known as the high tenor of the  pop-opera boyband G4 In 2007 this group disbanded and Ansell embarked on a solo career recording various albums and playing in musical productions and on television.

name: Edda Dell'Orso
comments: Singer, best known for her work in Italian film scores of composers such as Luis Bacalov , Piero Piccioni and especially Ennio Morricone .

name: Alain Lacour
comments: Guitarist, manager, songwriter, music director, producer

name: Peppe Servillo
comments: Singer, songwriter and actor. Peppe is the brother of actor Toni Servillo.

name: Ralph Benatar
comments: Born as Joseph Avion in Elisabethville, Congo where he learned to play the piano, he moved to Belgium in 1960 to spread his musical horizon and to learn to play guitar. There he changed his name into "Ralph Benatar". In 1966 he formed the J.J. Band and together with the duo Jess & James (the Portugese brothers Fernando and Antonio Lameirinhos) he had a hit with "Move".

name: Lena Valaitis
comments: Lithuanian–German schlager singer who had her greatest success during the 1970s and 1980s. She finished second at the 1981 Eurovision Song Contest.
